content.description: Begin on two matching slopers.  Use a sidepull and positve crimps to reach a good horizontal.  From there, make one final move and finish in the jug below the roof.
content.location: Located about 10 ft left of the start hold for Spike.

content.description:
This is route #2 on Big Block 2 in the Falcon guidebook by Brayack and Keenan.

This sit starts on a low flake and accompanied by good feet. Move to an obvious, large sloper and through a second flake, perhaps utilizing a hidden hold. Make a move to a right hand jug, before moving slightly left for the final move up to the jug rail above the roof.

Start below an obvious right leaning finger crack that leads you into an alcove below a roof. Once in the alcove, follow a very positive horizontal flake out and around the roof to the right. Pull the roof and climb the face just to the left of the tree to the top.
content.protection: Protects reasonably well with a standard rack, save a #1 cam for the face right after you pull the roof. You can also toprope from a tree anchor.
content.location: On the Sunset Wall side of Big Blocks. Just to the right of the obvious Organic Matter flake, near the center of the face.

content.description:
Start matched on the furthest right low sloper on this face. Make a long move to a crimp find feet and make a move to the good horizontal. Finish at the seam below the roof.

This route is #5 on Big Blocks Boulder 2 in the Brayack and Keenan falcon guidebook.
content.location: This route is the furthest route on the face just left of the low overhang that contains the problem Spike.

content.description: Begins with a bouldery sequence under a small 2' overhang.  Once you pull the overhang, follow the generous ledges to the vegetation line at the top.
content.protection: Tope Rope, natural anchors at the top. Protects reasonably well with a standard rack plus a #4 cam just above the roof.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the river facing side of Big Blocks.

content.description: Climb the face below a hemlock tree to a "pistol grip" hold about halfway up. Use flakes to climb up and slightly right to a small ledge. A slightly more difficult direct version can be climbed by going straight up and avoiding the ledge near the top.
content.location: Located about 15 feet left of the arete on the right side of the Big Blocks. Located directly across from the "Into the Sunset" chimney on Sunset Wall.

content.description: Climb the white face about 12 feet left of "Riverside Face" to the top.
content.location: About 12' left of "Riverside Face" on the river side of Big Blocks.

content.description: Climb the very strenuous face to the left of the "Sharkfin" arete.
content.location: The face in between the "Sharkfin" arete and "Friends in High Places". Near where the approach trail meets Big Blocks.

content.description: This popular route climbs the center of the face following a faint white streak. You will understand the name of the climb once you reach the top of the route.
content.location: Located in the center of the face in between the left arete and "Organic Matter" on the shady side of Big Blocks.

content.description: Follow the face just left of the obvious/popular crack line known as a Organic Matter (5.5).  Use none of the features on Organic Matter, try using only faceholds for hands/feet.
content.location: Northeastern side of the 'Big Blocks'.  An obvious crack named Organic Matter (5.5) is just to the right of this super fun line.

content.description:
This is the V3 Variation of route #6 on Big Block 2 in the Falcon guidebook by Brayack and Keenan.

Instead of pulling the overhang on the jugs out left, stay on the nose of the overhang until the top out. See photo on Spike 1.0 page.

Downclimb a little and jump on your pad after the top-out.
Start on the obvious spike jug underneath the overhang. Move right and then left up over the bulge on jugs. Top out on the ledge, and then jump off on your pad.
content.location: Under the overhang on the riverside of Big Block 2. Starts on only spike-like jug.

content.description: Climb the nice slightly overhanging clean just to the left of "Access Crack". Also known as "Affinity Triangle".
content.location: The arete just to the left of "Access Crack" right where the approach trail meets Big Blocks.

content.description: Start just to the left of the white rock on the right arching overhang. Climb the cracks and knobby face to the top. Also known as "Grunge Festivale".
content.protection: Standard rack or toprope from natural anchors. This climb protects very well.
content.location: Located on the river side of Big Blocks on the right side of the wall. Just to the left of "White Wall Overhang".

content.description: One of the best easy trad routes at Coopers Rock. Climb the obvious left facing flake while making use of some helpful face holds and pockets along the way. This route is a great introduction to trad climbing and it protects very well.
content.protection: Standard rack or toprope from tree anchor. This climb also protects very well passively with medium to large hexes and nuts.
content.location: Located on the shady side of Big Blocks facing Sunset Wall. This climb is on the left side of that face.

content.description:
Start sitting at the obvious jug on the left side of the white face of the Big Blocks boulder 2. Move up and slightly left using body tension through either a sloping rail or a thin sharp flake to another jug. From here go right to a protruding hold and finish on the jug over the roof.

This route is #1 on Big Blocks Boulder 2 in the Brayack and Keenan falcon guidebook.
content.location: On the river side face of Big Blocks this route is on the far right end of the face under the roof the holds the white different colored rock. On the far left side of this white face is the jug that starts this route. This route is the first route on this face.

content.description: Begin by climbing the arete and then trend right onto the face and to the top following the path of least resistance.
content.location: Located on the shady side, on the arete just to the right of the gap between the two Big Blocks.

content.description: Climb the face in between the arete climb "The End"and "Titanium Digit" while avoiding the holds on both routes.
content.location: About 5 feet to the right of the arete on the shady side of Big Blocks.

content.description: Climb up a black and white face using small pockets and round edges.
content.location: Located about 6 feet right of the orange streak in the middle of the face to the left of the chimney between the Big Blocks on the river side.

content.description:
Start on a left facing side pull and low right undercling.  Dyno for the jug, then make a final easy move, finishing in the horizontal below the roof.

This route is # 3a on Big Block 2 in the Brayack & Keenan guidebook.
content.location: Near the center of the white face on Big Block 2

content.description: Climb the grungy wide crack on the river side face...or better yet, don't.
content.protection: Meduim to big gear or toprope from tree anchor
content.location: The wide rounded crack on the river side face of Big Blocks.

content.description: Start at a small roof with blocky holds and climb up through a crack that takes you up and left to a crescent shaped feature. Climb from here straight to the top. A slightly harder variation goes up and right at the top of the crack.
content.location: On the face around the arete to the right of the chimney that splits the Big Blocks on the river side.

content.description: Follow crescent shaped holds up the face in between the "Organic Matter" flake and the "Zig Zag Wanderer" finger crack. Finish in the notch at the top just left of the roof.
content.location: The face in between the "Organic Matter" flake and the "Zig Zag Wanderer" finger crack on the shady side of Big Blocks.

content.description:
The hardest part of this route is the establish followed closely by the first move. Start matched on the left-facing sidepull/edge combo. After the body tension establish, make a long move to a jug and finish at the seam just below the roof.

This route is #3 on Big Blocks Boulder 2 in the Brayack and Keenan falcon guidebook.

Note: Only use the start hold specified. A variation of this route (Guerrilla Warfare) utilizes the undercling low and right.
content.location: This route starts on the noticeable sidepull flake feature in the middle of the white face.

content.description: Climb the far right arete using some holds on the left face and the crack near the top.
content.protection: Standard rack or toprope from tree anchor
content.location: Located on the far right arete on the shady side of Big Blocks. Directly across from "Copenhagen" on Sunset Wall.

content.description: Climb the far left arete on the shady side of the Big Blocks. Also known as "Schoonerete".
content.location: The far left arete on the shady side of the Big Blocks facing Sunset Wall.

content.description: Climb straight up the pocketed orange streak finishing just to the right of the pine tree at the top.
content.location: The orange streak towards the left side of the river side face a about 10 feet to the right of "Access Crack".

content.description: Climb the face next to the chimney through hidden horizontals of the top.
content.location: The face just to the right of the of the chimney that splits the Big Blocks on the river side.

content.description: Pull a low 2 foot roof about 10 feet off of the ground and climb the face above it to the top.
content.location: Located on the shady side about 20 feet left of the gap between the two Big Blocks below a low roof.

content.description: This is the easiest access to the top of Big Blocks, often soloed to set up other climbs on toprope. Climb a few moves to access the short dihedral and take it to the top. There is often webbing stuffed in the crack near the top to aid with soloing this route, use it at your own risk.
content.protection: A few medium sized cams, toprope from tree anchor, or a very easy solo.
content.location: One of the first climbs you come to when approaching Big Blocks from the approach trail.
